title: React Expo Developer for Web and Native App with Supabase & Stripe Integration
description:
Claw Machine App ‚Äì Development Project Scope
Overview
We are building a cross-platform Claw Machine App that will run on iOS, Android, and Web. The app will let users register, purchase ‚Äútoken packs‚Äù via Stripe Checkout, track their token balance in a Supabase-backed wallet, queue for games, and simulate gameplay with win/loss logic.
We are looking for an experienced developer to design, build, and deliver the frontend, backend, and integrations.

Tech Stack Requirements
Frontend: React + Expo (single codebase for Android, iOS, and web)
Backend: Node.js + Express, written in TypeScript
Database & Auth: Supabase (Postgres + Auth)
Payments: Stripe Checkout integration (no PCI data stored in our DB)
Version Control: All commits must be pushed to the provided GitHub repository



üìã Features & Scope
0. All Styling should be handled by a central CSS/Theme file/folder

1. Splash Screen
Display logo and branding (use generic images for the time being) 
Automatically route to login/register or game selector based on session state

2. User Registration & Authentication
Sign up with:
Username + password
Google OAuth (via Supabase Auth)
Post-sign-up: redirect to Purchase Token Page
Login: redirect to Game Selector Page
3. Purchase Token Packs
Integrate with Stripe Checkout for secure payments
Token packs available for purchase (configurable via Supabase)
Store stripe_payment_intent, stripe_checkout_session, and receipt_url in the purchases table
Tokens credited to user wallet upon successful payment webhook

4. Wallet Page
Display current token balance
Display purchase + spend history
Provide ‚ÄúQuick Buy‚Äù option for common token packs

5. Game Selector Page
Display available games (a game is a ‚Äúmachine‚Äù and should be a table in the database)
Allow joining a queue for a game

6. Game Queuing System
Users can join a queue for a specific game (Supabase function with ON CONFLICT handling)
Display queue position in real time (using Supabase Realtime or polling)

7. Game Page (Simulated Gameplay)
Stream (placeholder) video feed of the claw machine
Control system simulation: buttons for movement + grab
Win/Loss system (simulated for MVP):

If win ‚Üí deduct token(s), add prize (with prize_id) to user‚Äôs account, store result in play history
If loss ‚Üí deduct token(s), update play history

8. Play History Page
List of past games with:
Date/time
Tokens used
Result (Win/Loss)
Prize won (if applicable)

9. Profile Page
Display and edit:

Username
Full Name
Avatar
Website (optional)
Show current token balance

10. Home Page
Quick links to main features (Play, Wallet, Purchase Tokens)
Display recent activity or promotional banners

11. Legal Pages
Terms of Service (TOS) page
Privacy Policy page


Database Requirements (Supabase)
users (linked to auth.users)
purchases (records each token pack purchase, with Stripe metadata)
wallets (tracks token balance per user)
wallet_transactions (audit log of spends/credits)
games (list of available games with metadata)
queue_entries (user queue positions per game, with status: QUEUED / NOTIFIED / ACTIVE)
plays (game play sessions with win/loss + prize_id)
Payments (Stripe)
Use Stripe Checkout for purchases
No card data stored in our DB
Implement Stripe Webhook to:
Verify payment_intent.succeeded events
Update user‚Äôs wallet balance and purchases table
Store receipt URL


Security
All API requests must be authenticated via Supabase JWT tokens
Backend validates Supabase JWT using project‚Äôs JWKS endpoint
Supabase RLS (Row-Level Security) applied to restrict data access per user
 Deliverables
Frontend (React/Expo)


iOS + Android apps (ready to submit to App Store & Play Store)
Web app (via Expo web)


Backend (Express + TypeScript)


Auth middleware validating Supabase JWT
Routes for wallet, purchases, games, queue, plays
Stripe webhook integration


Database (Supabase)


Schema with migrations
Row Level Security (RLS) policies for user-scoped data


Documentation


Setup instructions (README)
API documentation (OpenAPI or Markdown)
Deployment guide


Code Quality


All commits pushed to provided GitHub repo
TypeScript types enforced
Basic unit tests for critical functions


Success Criteria
Users can register/login (username/password or Google)
Users can buy token packs through Stripe Checkout
Wallet reflects correct balances after purchases/spends
Users can join queues and play games (simulated video + win/loss)
Game/prize results are recorded in play history
iOS, Android, and web versions all function smoothly
Code is clean, modular, and well-documented


Game Play Details 

The buttons for movement can currently just console.log the direction they are moving, later on it will tie into an IOT eventbus for now we can simulate the action in console
The video can be a simulated stream, that is configurable via env variables.

title: Senior Full Stack Engineer(JavaScript, Python)
description:
About the Role

We are looking for a highly skilled Full Stack Engineer with expertise in the MERN stack (MongoDB, Express.js, React, Node.js) and solid experience in Python development. In this role, you will design, develop, and deploy scalable web applications, APIs, and services, working closely with product managers, designers, and other engineers to deliver exceptional digital experiences.

Responsibilities
- Design and build end-to-end features across the stack using React, Node.js, Express, and MongoDB.
- Develop and maintain RESTful and GraphQL APIs, ensuring high performance and responsiveness.
- Leverage Python for backend services, data pipelines, automation, or integration tasks.
- Write clean, maintainable, and well-tested code following best practices.
- Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define technical requirements and deliver solutions.
- Optimize applications for maximum performance, scalability, and security.
- Participate in code reviews, mentorship, and knowledge sharing within the team.
- Deploy, monitor, and maintain applications in cloud environments (AWS, GCP, or Azure).

Requirements
- Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field, or equivalent experience.
- Over 9 years of professional full-stack development experience.
- Strong proficiency in JavaScript/TypeScript, React, Node.js, Express, and MongoDB.
- Proven experience with Python (Django, Flask, or FastAPI preferred).
- Experience building and consuming REST and/or GraphQL APIs.
- Familiarity with Docker, CI/CD pipelines, and cloud services (AWS/GCP/Azure).
- Solid understanding of data modeling, caching, and scalability principles.
- Strong problem-solving skills and ability to work in an agile environment.

Nice to Have
- Experience with microservices architecture.
- Knowledge of message queues (Kafka, RabbitMQ, etc.).
- Exposure to DevOps practices (Terraform, Kubernetes).
- Familiarity with testing frameworks (Jest, Mocha, PyTest).

title: Fullstack Developer Needed for Software Development Business
description:
**Job Description:**

We are excited to announce an opportunity for a talented and motivated fullstack developer to join our dynamic and innovative software development team. In this role, you will be a key player in shaping the future of our products and services. The ideal candidate will possess a strong grasp of both front-end and back-end technologies, demonstrating extensive experience in building, deploying, and scaling robust web applications. Your expertise will enable you to contribute significantly to our projects, ensuring that we deliver high-quality solutions that not only meet but exceed our clients' needs and expectations.

As a fullstack developer, you will collaborate closely with other developers, designers, and product managers to design, develop, and implement cutting-edge solutions. You will be responsible for writing clean, maintainable, and efficient code while adhering to best practices in software development. Your role will also involve troubleshooting and debugging issues as they arise, ensuring that our applications run smoothly and efficiently.

In addition to your technical abilities, we are looking for someone who thrives in a collaborative environment and is passionate about coding and technology. If you enjoy tackling complex challenges and are eager to contribute to exciting projects that have a real-world impact, we want to hear from you! 

We believe in fostering a culture of continuous learning and growth, so we encourage our team members to share their knowledge and explore new technologies. You will have the opportunity to work on a variety of projects, allowing you to expand your skill set and stay updated with the latest industry trends. 

**Key Responsibilities:**
- Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define, design, and ship new features.
- Build and maintain responsive, user-friendly web applications using modern front-end frameworks.
- Develop and maintain server-side logic and database management systems to support application functionality.
- Create and maintain APIs to connect front-end and back-end services.
- Write unit tests and conduct code reviews to ensure code quality and reliability.
- Stay up-to-date with emerging technologies and industry trends to continuously improve your skill set and contribute to team knowledge.

**Relevant Skills:**
- Proficiency in HTML, CSS, and JavaScript, with a deep understanding of modern front-end frameworks such as React.js or Angular.
- Experience with back-end technologies such as Node.js, and the ability to implement server-side logic.
- Strong knowledge of database management systems (both SQL and NoSQL) and an understanding of data modeling.
- Experience in API development, including RESTful services and understanding of best practices in API design.
- Familiarity with version control systems, particularly Git, to manage code versions and collaborate effectively with team members.
- Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to work independently as well as part of a team.

If you are ready to take the next step in your career and join a forward-thinking company that values innovation and creativity, please submit your application. We look forward to hearing from you!

- Clean up the homepage layout‚Äîmake important info easy to find, preferably using my existing theme and content.
- Ensure the site works well on mobile devices.
- Implement basic SEO best practices (titles, descriptions ready for Google search).
- Please avoid ‚Äúover-designing‚Äù or adding custom animations, graphics, or complex features.
- Site must be very simple, clean, and practical for weekly updates.

- The site is managed by me, which sometimes leads to inconsistent design issues, font colors and sizes, and incorrect photo/graphic sizes. I need it cleaned up, but don't want it to look too cookie-cutter. I don't want to lose my ability to add my own touches.

Budget & Scope:

- Fixed-fee preferred. Open to hourly if carefully tracked.

Ideal Candidate:
- Experience with WordPress, especially updating existing sites.

- Patient communicator, able to explain basic site updates so I can maintain content after project completion.
- References or samples of previous work for small business/theatre/arts websites appreciated.

title: Full-stack dev help with various work

Description:

We are seeking a skilled and proactive Full-Stack Software Developer to help us with an exciting new venture-building tool called "Changepreneurship." Our mission is to make entrepreneurship accessible to everyone by creating a powerful, AI-driven business development tool.

This is a short-term, well-defined project perfect for a developer who is efficient and enjoys working with AI-generated code.

Project Responsibilities:

Your primary goal is to help us take our AI-generated project from a code package to a functional, user-facing tool hosted on GitHub Pages. The project will involve the following four key tasks, which we aim to complete within 5 iterative rounds of work:

- GitHub Pages Deployment: Take our existing GitHub repository and successfully publish it as a live GitHub Pages website.

- Code Analysis & Debugging: We have a .zip file containing code generated by our AI bot (Manus). You will need to set this up in a code editor, run it, and analyze it to identify bugs, errors, and areas that need fixing to become functional.AI 

- Prompt Engineering: Based on your analysis, you will provide us with clear, effective suggestion prompts that we can feed back into our AI bot (Manus) to generate improved code.

- UI Co-Development: Working alongside Manus (our AI), you will help build a user interface (UI) that allows end-users to interact with the tool. This final UI will be integrated into the GitHub repository.

Project Scope & Deliverables:

The project is considered complete when all four of the above objectives have been met. We envision this being accomplished within approximately five rounds of feedback and development between you and our team.

Ideal Candidate:
- Proven experience as a Full-Stack Developer.
- Strong proficiency with Git, GitHub, and deploying websites using GitHub Pages.
- Comfortable analyzing, debugging, and refactoring code generated by AI tools.
- Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to work independently.
- Good communication skills to clearly explain technical issues and suggest prompts.

Project Details:Budget: 
$50 (one-off fixed price for the entire scope)
Timeline: 1 week

If you are a resourceful developer excited by the intersection of AI and entrepreneurship, we would love to hear from you. 

Please apply with a brief summary of your experience related to the tasks described above.

title: NFL Picks Competition Website
description:
I want to build a simple web application where users can create accounts, join private leagues, and compete by picking NFL games against the spread each week. I already have a working prototype in Google Sheets, but I‚Äôd like to move this into a proper website with accounts, leagues, and a leaderboard.
Core Features Needed

User Accounts & Authentication

Email login (magic link or passwordless preferred) or Google sign-in.

Each user has a profile with display name.

Leagues

Users can create leagues and become the commissioner.

Invite system: members can join via unique join code.

Commissioner manages weekly games.

Game Setup

Each week has 5 games:

Thursday night, Sunday 1PM, Sunday 4PM, Sunday night, Monday night.

Commissioner enters matchups, spreads, and scores.

Support for updating spreads weekly.

Picks

Players make 1 pick per game: Favorite, Underdog, or Pass.

Picks lock after submission (no edits allowed).

From Week 5 onwards, only the league leader must pick first before others can make their picks. Commissioner can override with a manual ‚ÄúOpen Week‚Äù button.

Leaderboard

Tracks weekly and season records (wins against the spread).

Updates automatically when commissioner enters scores.

Hosting & Embedding

The site should be hosted on Netlify or Vercel (I already use GoDaddy and may embed it into my website).

Needs to be mobile-friendly.

Tech Stack (preferred but flexible)

Supabase (for database + auth).

React / Next.js or similar for the front-end.

Open to no-code/low-code solutions (Bubble, WeWeb) if they can deliver the same features.

Deliverables

A working hosted site where I can:

Create leagues

Add weekly games

Let users pick

View leaderboard

Clean, well-documented code or no-code configuration.

Instructions on how to maintain and update it myself (add new seasons, reset leagues, etc.).

Budget & Timeline

Budget: Flexible depending on scope ($500 ‚Äì $2000 range for MVP).

Timeline: Ideally, ready before or during the 2026 NFL season.

What I‚Äôm Looking For

Experience with Supabase (or Firebase) and React, OR strong no-code development experience.

Ability to make a clean, user-friendly UI.

Good communication and willingness to explain how to maintain the site after delivery.

title: Wordpress design implementation
description:
Awesome‚Äîhere‚Äôs a tight Upwork brief you can paste as-is. I‚Äôve kept timelines as low as reasonably possible and pointed the freelancer to the exact files/code so they can replicate without guessing.

---

# Upwork Brief ‚Äî Implement 3 UI updates (Next.js + Tailwind + shadcn/ui)

## Overview

We‚Äôre updating our marketing site with three UI changes. All designs, tokens, and example code are provided. Your job is to implement the pages/components to match the provided references with pixel-level care, responsive behavior, and basic accessibility.

## Tech stack

* Next.js (App Router preferred), TypeScript
* Tailwind CSS (arbitrary values enabled)
* shadcn/ui (Button, Card)
* lucide-react (icons)

If your boilerplate differs, please note and plan minimal mappings to match tokens (colors, radius 16px, shadows) and global background.

## What you‚Äôll build (3 items)

1. **Feature Group page (‚ÄúOperations‚Äù)**
   Build a new page from the provided handoff (hero left text / right image, alternating media/text rows, teal ‚ÄúAsk a Question‚Äù band with **invert-on-hover**, and ‚ÄúExplore Other Features‚Äù chips + dynamic blurb + example cards).

   * Spec & full Next.js page code are provided in our **Developer Handoff ‚Äî Feature Group Page (Operations)** doc (we‚Äôll share this file in the repo; includes tokens, layout, accessibility notes, and the full `page.tsx` implementation).

2. **Features page (final modern version)**
   Ensure our features page matches the provided finalized HTML (hero, CTA, six feature cards with mini icons, teal ‚ÄúAsk a Question‚Äù hover invert, filter chips + blurbs + example cards). The file has working CSS and structure‚Äîreplicate it in our Next.js codebase (Tailwind/shadcn) and align tokens. 

3. **Landing header with Mega Menu**
   Implement the sticky header + **mega menu** exactly like the provided React/Tailwind example (hover to open ‚ÄúProduct‚Äù and ‚ÄúSolutions‚Äù panels, gradient aside, clean typography, and button set on the right). Port the markup/behavior into our header component. 

## Provided assets & references (all you need)

* **Features Page (Final, standalone HTML)** ‚Äî use as visual & structural truth and port to our stack. 
* **Landing Page ‚Äî Mega Menu (React + Tailwind demo)** ‚Äî copy behavior/structure into our header. 
* **Feature Group (Operations) Handoff** ‚Äî tokens, spacing, background gradient method (banding-proof), accessibility, and **full page code** to drop into `app/(marketing)/operations/page.tsx`.

  * Headings `#1F2975`, body `#433FA3`, primary CTA `#A98BFF` (hover `#8F73FF`), teal `#48A9A6`, radius 16px, shadows (sm/md/lg).
  * Fixed **full-viewport gradient + radials** as two **fixed** layers so the background is even edge-to-edge.
  * Ask button hover **inverts** (white bg + teal text/border).

Confirmation: between the two attached files and the handoff doc, **everything required to replicate the UI is present** (layout, tokens, interactions, code). No design guesswork is needed.  

## Deliverables

* 3 merged features:

  1. `app/(marketing)/operations/page.tsx` implemented per handoff.
  2. `app/(marketing)/features/page.tsx` (or equivalent) aligned to the final HTML reference.
  3. Updated `Header` with mega menu matching the demo.
* CSS/tokens in Tailwind (no custom frameworks).
* Wire ‚ÄúAsk a Question‚Äù to a placeholder link or modal trigger (no backend needed).
* Replace placeholder images with provided files/paths; use `next/image` where appropriate.
* Light analytics stubs (optional): console events for CTA, chip clicks, card clicks.

## Acceptance criteria (quick QA)

* **Visual parity** with references at 320, 768, 1024, 1280, 1440 px.
* Background gradient continuous top‚Üíbottom (no banding/‚Äústop‚Äù at scroll).
* Buttons & chips match colors and **hover states** (teal invert on Ask).
* Chips update `aria-selected`; example cards filter by category; blurb updates.
* Cards uniform heights; subtle hover elevation.
* Alternating rows align cleanly at lg+, stack at sm.
* Basic a11y: alt text, focus states intact, readable contrast.
* Works in latest Chrome/Safari/Firefox.



## Handover

* PR(s) with clean commits and brief README notes (what changed, where tokens live, how to update blurbs/cards).

title: Seeking Postgres/Full-Stack Developer for Gamification Logic Cleanup & Normalization
description:
I'm adding gamification to a news web platform mmorpgupdates,com (Next.js + Supabase) and need help cleaning up and normalizing the gamification logic. 

Right now, XP, levels, and activity/notification logs work but are inconsistent between frontend and backend. Ultimately, users should be granted XP for activities throughout the site (frontend), recorded on backend (Supabase), and rendered in frontend.

Some of the XP logic is duplicated in React, while Supabase functions (increment_xp, award_xp_and_log, triggers) also handle parts of it. Notifications sometimes fail due to constraint mismatches.

Goals:
Normalize XP + Level Logic
Ensure XP awarding always goes through a single source of truth (increment_xp + award_xp_and_log).
Enforce level progression rules from the user_levels table.
Enhance existing level-up detection and notifications.
Fix Notifications Flow
Standardize notification type values (e.g. xp, level_up, achievement) for scalability
Ensure descriptive text/reason is stored in message or metadata instead of misusing type.
Clean up constraints so no invalid inserts occur.
Refactor React hooks (useActivityLogger, useXPService, GamificationWrapper) to remove duplicate XP math and rely on backend RPC responses.
Ensure XP and level updates propagate cleanly via subscriptions or optimistic updates.
Provide clear TypeScript types for XP/level responses.

Deliverables:
Cleaned and normalized SQL functions (increment_xp, award_xp_and_log, log_activity).
Updated Supabase schema & constraints (esp. notifications).
Refactored frontend hooks & wrappers so XP/levels/notifications are consistent and rely on backend logic.
Documentation of the final gamification flow

Tech Stack
Frontend: Next.js 14/15, React, TypeScript, TailwindCSS
Backend: Supabase (Postgres, RLS, Functions, Triggers)

Gamification: XP system, levels via user_levels table, activity logs, notifications

Qualifications
Strong Postgres SQL & PL/pgSQL (functions, triggers, constraints).
Hands-on experience with Supabase (RPCs, RLS, schema migrations).
Full-stack React/Next.js with TypeScript for frontend integration.
Familiarity with gamification mechanics (XP systems, leveling, badges)
Experience designing event logging/notification systems

Engagement
This is a short-term project with potential for future work. Deliverables are well-scoped (backend cleanup + frontend integration). I typically work hourly contracts.

Requirements
I do require a signed NDA prior to showing any site code and engaging in work.

title: Executive Resume and LinkedIn Specialist
description:
STEADY INCOME: Receive a daily stream of new resume and LinkedIn profile writing jobs without having to do sales or marketing!

The Ambitious Execs helps US based Directors, VPs, and C-Suite leaders to get hired faster.  A core part of our offering is resume re-write and LinkedIn review & recommendations.

HOW IT WORKS:
- You will be assigned a steady stream of work (resumes and linkedIn profiles) - approx 30 of each every month
- We already generate the new resume using AI based on the client's existing resume, accomplishments, and unique value proposition.   The AI is pretty good - it does about 80% of the work, including generating questions for the client (usually about quantifying their accomplishments, etc)
- You take the AI draft, review it, make sure nothing is fabricated, inaccurate, etc.  Make sure that the questions going back to the client are the "right" questions.  Make sure the resume represents the client's desired brand.  Edit as needed
- Do a final ATS compatibility, spelling, grammar check
- You send the draft to the client including the questions, then incorporate the client's inputs into a final draft
- There may be a few iterations and you may need to speak with the client once or twice.  
- The LinkedIn process is similar, though there is no AI yet.  Review their profile and provide basic feedback via a template.  For example, profile picture, banner, tag line, summary section, etc.  This is taking us about 20mins per profile.  No back and forth with the client needed.

PAY:  $50 per completed Resume and $20 per LinkedIn.  No sales or marketing and we will keep you busy with a constant stream of work.

ONLY APPLY IF:
- You know how to use AI to make your job easier
- You have executive presence sufficient for calls with US executives.  You can push back, ask the right questions, make them comfortable, build credibility and authority.  Must be a good listener
- You have experience writing resumes and LinkedIn profiles
- You can work US timezones (a few hours difference is OK, but must be able to hop on client calls during the day if needed, though these are rare)
- Strong attention to detail
- You have understanding of resume components (executive summary, construction of each bullet point, achievements)

***Budget is weekly and does not include weekly bonus and additional compensation***

Do you thrive in "wonder what today's going to bring" environments where you're able to touch a variety of aspects of a business? Third - this has the opportunity to become full time in the US. We have a presence in NYC, Miami, San Francisco, and Nashville. Apply from anywhere, after decades of office life we're now fully "remote" although we maintain the office line item in the budget for space or fun travel for meetings when we need it.

Please have some experience - we're not going to put in "you must have" but if you've got some years of experience under your belt being a "do-er" that works well with others in fast (FAST) paced environments, that counts. You must be "business"-brained and have some knowledge of tech and marketing. We don't care if you have an anthropology degree (we've hired anthropologists before) as long as you're up to speed with the latest in tech and AI trends and think that marketing is probably the most fun and creative sectors of business you can be in.

We're moving fast, we're growing fast, we're looking for someone who can share our vision to ride the AI wave with a great product that delivers so that after we've made our mark in a few years time we can all take a breath and relax for a bit.

title: Full Stack Development Team for Final Polish on React & Flutter Web App
description:
About Us
METRO is an electric mobility company creating cutting-edge e-scooters, e-bikes, accessories and a premium riding experience. Our current development team has completed most of the work for our website and app (React for web, Flutter for app) back end function is complete. We are now seeking a top-tier full-stack team to finish and elevate the project to launch-ready status. We will need your teams full attention for 1 full month.

Scope of Work
Finalize backend functionality of our 90% complete website and app.
	‚Ä¢	Implement our finalized Figma designs exactly to the size of the font and exact designs throughout, or even enhance them beyond expectations without ANY deviation. If you are not capable of this. DO NOT APPLY. 
	‚Ä¢	Integrate and edit only the color of our 3D product renditions seamlessly into both the website and app for a premium, dynamic feel.
	‚Ä¢	Ensure pixel-perfect front-end execution and smooth UI/UX transitions across web and mobile.
	‚Ä¢	Review and refine backend functionality for speed, security, and scalability. Domain hosting change (currently name cheap) is expected to handle high traffic volumes to avoid congestion. 
	‚Ä¢	Optimize responsive design for all screen sizes and devices.
	‚Ä¢	Conduct final bug fixes, QA, and polish so the product is ready for public launch.

Data Access & Security Requirements (IMPORTANT)
	‚Ä¢	You will be granted temporary access to necessary credentials (domain info, Stripe integration, and others) strictly for implementation purposes.
	‚Ä¢	All databases, sales, shipping, and inventory systems remain under Metro‚Äôs control ‚Äî you are not permitted to view, extract, or store this data.
	‚Ä¢	Access will be given only to implement changes, and we will revoke it together immediately upon completion of the agreed tasks.
	‚Ä¢	You must work within Metro‚Äôs controlled environment no unauthorized data migration, backup, or third-party storage is allowed.

Requirements
	‚Ä¢	Proven experience with React, Flutter, Node.js, and relevant backend tech.
	‚Ä¢	Ability to execute exact Figma replication with zero compromise on design fidelity.
	‚Ä¢	Demonstrated portfolio of high-end UI/UX work.
	‚Ä¢	Experience integrating 3D product renders or similar interactive visual assets.
	‚Ä¢	Strong understanding of security, optimization, and cross-platform consistency.
	‚Ä¢	Ability to take existing codebases and deliver rapid, high-quality finalization.
‚Ä¢ Hardware integration may be necessary on your end. We are including it in the scope of work, you will potentially be sent hardware, but it is not certain. We are working closely with our supplier, we will send them the app to code in the bluetooth integration. If they cannot meet our time requirements you will be expected to fulfill this role at this cost. 

What We Expect (Please Read)

If you cannot deliver our design exactly as is (or better), do not apply. This is not a ‚Äúre-interpretation‚Äù job  it‚Äôs a precision execution role with creative polish. We are looking for efficiency, skill, and attention to detail, not guesswork. We are looking to launch now with our exact Figma designs exactly. Everything is ready for the final Maestros to put it together. 

How to Apply
	‚Ä¢	Share your most relevant portfolio pieces that match the quality we expect.
	‚Ä¢	Briefly describe your process for taking over an existing project and delivering a flawless finish.
	‚Ä¢	Confirm your availability and timeline to start immediately. We need to launch this website immediately, so please provide an accurate timeline. 

Project Type: Contract / Project-Based
Location: Remote (must be in the USA)

title: üöÄThe Sales Dream Job: Earn Six Figures and Work on Your Own Terms
description:
The Sales Dream Job: Earn Six Figures and Work on Your Own Terms

Start your application with "I Close Inbound" or your application will not be read.

You're a closer. You've been doing this for a while, and you know what you're capable of. You're tired of cold calls, unqualified leads, and a compensation plan that doesn't reward your hustle.

What if there was a role where the leads are piping hot, ready to buy, and the only limit on your income is your own drive?

That's exactly what we're offering. We're a fast-growing company that provides high-value educational services, and we're looking for a few top-tier closers to join our team. We don't just want employees; we want partners who will thrive in a flexible, high-reward environment.

Why You'll Want to Work With Us
Work from Anywhere: All you need is a laptop, a great headset, and a quiet space. No camera required. This is a dream for anyone who values freedom and flexibility.

Complete Flexibility: You set your own hours. Whether you want to work full-time or part-time, morning or night, it's entirely up to you.

The Leads are on Fire: We're not talking about lukewarm inquiries. These are pre-qualified, inbound leads who are already expecting your call and are ready to buy. Our current team is closing at a 40-60% conversion rate. You only need 20% to qualify for bonuses.

Uncapped Earning Potential: This is where things get interesting. We pay a competitive base hourly rate of $20 - $35/hour, but the real money is in the commissions. You earn a 5% commission on every sale‚Äîthat's $125+ per deal.

Exponential Commission Growth: This isn't your average commission structure. Our service can be purchased as a flat $2,500 payment or in five monthly payments of $555. With the monthly payment option, you get 5% of each installment. That means your commission earnings from previous months stack up, allowing you to build a substantial passive income stream. Close just three deals a day on the monthly plan, and within five months, you could be earning over $9,400 per month in commissions alone, on top of your hourly rate.

The Role in a Nutshell
You'll handle pre-scheduled inbound phone consultations with warm leads.

Initially, calls are scheduled for 45 minutes, but top closers can land the deal in 20-25 minutes. After a month, you'll move to 30-minute call slots, potentially taking 16+ calls a day with 8 hours of availability.

Master our proven sales script while adding your personal touch to build trust quickly and authentically.

Log your calls and follow up professionally.

Continuously improve your skills and strive to hit and exceed your KPIs.

Who We‚Äôre Looking For
A true closer: You have 1-2+ years of experience in inbound sales, preferably in a high-ticket environment (education, coaching, SaaS). You don't need hand-holding.

Script-savvy: You can quickly internalize a script and make it your own.

Relatable & Trustworthy: You're a great listener and can build rapport in minutes.

Driven: You're hungry for success and motivated by uncapped earning potential.

Ready to Change Your Life?
If you‚Äôre ready to get off the cold-call grind and step into a role where your hard work directly translates into massive financial freedom, apply now. We're hiring three closers this week who are ready to hit the ground running.

How to Apply (Please Follow Exactly):
Start your message with "I Close Inbound."

Share your recent sales numbers (close rate, average deal size, monthly volume) in three bullet points.

Record a brief video (45-90 seconds) using a tool like Loom. Introduce yourself and tell us why you'd be a great fit for our team.

Confirm you can quickly memorize scripts and list your availability within our open hours of 9am - 9pm Central Time.

List the CRMs and calendaring tools you‚Äôve used (e.g., HubSpot, Close, GHL, Calendly) and your proficiency level.

Do you have what it takes to land hot leads and build a six-figure income from home? We're excited to find out.

title: Tech Team Needed for CRM Development
description:
## Short Description
A software development service helps businesses design, build, deploy, and maintain custom applications, websites, or platforms. It can include full-cycle development (from concept to launch), integration of third-party tools, automation, and ongoing support to ensure scalability, security, and performance.  

---

## Requirements Needed

### 1. Business Requirements / Objectives
- Clear description of the problem to solve or the process to improve.  
- Expected outcomes (e.g., efficiency, automation, revenue growth, user engagement).  

### 2. Functional Requirements
- Key features the software must include (e.g., user login, dashboards, payments, reporting).  
- Integrations needed (APIs, CRM, ERP, third-party apps).  

### 3. Technical Requirements
- Preferred technologies or platforms (e.g., React, Node.js, Python, cloud provider).  
- Performance, security, and compliance standards (e.g., GDPR, HIPAA, ISO).  

### 4. Design & User Experience
- UI/UX guidelines, branding, accessibility needs.  
- Wireframes, prototypes, or references if available.  

### 5. Project Management Requirements
- Timeline expectations (MVP vs. full product).  
- Milestones and delivery schedule.  
- Collaboration style (Agile/Scrum, Kanban, Waterfall).  

### 6. Budget & Resource Requirements
- Estimated budget range.  
- Dedicated resources (internal SMEs, product owners, testers).  

### 7. Support & Maintenance
- Post-launch support level (bug fixes, updates, scaling).  
- Documentation and training requirements.
